commitResults.messageTitle: Duke.java: Added formatAnswer method for formatting Duke's outputs
Duke.java: Updated main(): Duke will now echo all commands (except exit on bye)
Duke.java: Fixed javadocs formatting
Command.java: Added Command class

* Abstracted commands - Duke.main() now only calls a CommandFactory to generate the right type of Command. Command is the abstract type for all possible commands to Duke. That command is then executed (polymorphism takes care of correct behaviour). * Echo function refactored to use Commands. * Exit function (bye) refactored to use Commands.
Formatting
TaskManager.java: Added TaskManager, to manage a todo list for the user.
Updated scope of abstract method in Command to public
Added AddTaskCommand and ListCommand
TaskManager.java: Changed taskList to use ArrayList instead of array type.
AddTaskCommand.java: * Now echos the task added back to the user * Includes formatting
ListCommand.java: Added formatted taskList printing.
Added support for marking tasks as done/undone
Revert "Added support for marking tasks as done/undone"
Revert "Revert "Added support for marking tasks as done/undone""
Added Mark and UnmarkCommand, for keeping track of completion status of tasks in taskList.
Formatting update * Added more static methods for formatting in Duke.java * Refactored many Command classes to now use these new methods for formatting
Mark/Unmark formatting update * Mark/Unmark commands now provide feedback in the console
Task inheritance * Updated Task.java to become a parent class of more specific subtpyes of classes.
Added 3 types of tasks * DeadlineTask * EventTask * TodoTask
Task.java: Updated tto become general parent class for the different types of tasks
CommandFactory.java: Added factory methods for 3 new tasks (Event, Deadline, Todo)
AddTaskCommand.java: Now adds the appropriate task to the TaskManager instead of just adding a Todo type task.
DeadlineTask: Formatting
DeadlineTask.java: Comment update
EventTask.java: Completed functionality
Duke lines *Changed Duke's introduction and goodbye message
Semi-automated testing *Updated expected and input files for use in testing
Exception handling: *Added custom DukeException exception *Handles errors for invalid commands *Handles errors for commands with insufficient parameters
Added delete functionality for deleting tasks from the task list
Fix Issue #1
Duke.java: Add tasklist.txt file on init functionality
commitResults.messageBody: Adds tasklist.txt file on program start if tasklist.txt does not yet exist. This is in preparation for saving task lists on the hard drive.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Duke.java
commitResults.messageBody: Added part of new code to init tasklist file in user directory if it does not exist

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Duke.java
Update AddTaskCommand.java
commitResults.messageBody: Started writing functionality for writing to tasklist.txt

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Task.java
commitResults.messageBody: Added getType command for retrieiving the type of task

commitResults.messageTitle: Update AddTaskCommand.java
commitResults.messageBody: Now writes tasks to tasklist.txt. Uses the Task's .toString() format.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor the way Duke updates tasklist.txt
commitResults.messageBody:
* TaskManager now takes care of writing to tasklist.txt
* Commands now no longer add to the tasklist ARRAY directly. They do so through TaskManager.add()
* Added FileWriter close() to Duke.java after program finishes execution (cleanup)

commitResults.messageTitle: Add task saving ability
commitResults.messageBody:
* Duke can now save tasks in tasklist.txt
* TaskManager takes care of rewriting files when tasks get added or deleted

commitResults.messageTitle: Added Duke functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
* Duke can now load tasks from tasklist.txt
* Added new CustomTask class to manage adding tasks back into the tasklist array from the text file (should not be used otherwise)

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix reader mistake in TaskManager.java
commitResults.messageBody: *Added reader.close() for BufferedReader at the end of loadTask

commitResults.messageTitle: Change file writing process
commitResults.messageBody: *Duke now only writes to file at the end of execution

commitResults.messageTitle: TaskManager.java: Delete unused code
Change DeadlineTask.java
commitResults.messageBody: * Deadlines now require yyyy-mm-dd formatted parameters, as the deadline date is now stored as LocalDate

commitResults.messageTitle: Change date display
commitResults.messageBody: *Duke now displays date in d MM yyyy format.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Ui to manage user interactions
commitResults.messageBody:
*Ui manages reading of inputs
*Ui manages printing of outputs

commitResults.messageTitle: ByeCommand.java: Move system print to Ui
commitResults.messageBody: ByeCommand now relies on Ui to output to the user

commitResults.messageTitle: ListCommand.java: Move system print to Ui
commitResults.messageBody: ListCommand now relies on Ui to output to the user (formatting of tasklist still done within ListCommand.java)

commitResults.messageTitle: Ui.java: Improve output format of printAddTask()
MarkCommand.java: Move system print to ui
commitResults.messageBody: * MarkCommand now relies on Ui for outputs to user

commitResults.messageTitle: MarkCommand.java: Deprecate unused code
